whyCrux.title: Why Crux Consulting?
whyCrux.subtitle: Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are the backbone of the economy in the European Union and play a central role in employment, revenue generation, and overall economic health. At the same time, they often lack the capacity to invest in AI on a large scale. This is where we come in to support you quickly and efficiently, unlocking the full potential of AI and automation available to us today.

whyCrux.title: Why 'CRUX Consulting'
whyCrux.description: In climbing, the crux is the most challenging and decisive part of the routeâ€”the point that requires focus, skill, and the right strategy to succeed. I believe Artificial Intelligence represents the crux moment for businesses today. It holds tremendous potential, but also complexity. Navigating this shift without the right support can feel like standing alone before a steep wallâ€”risky, overwhelming, and easy to fall back. Crux Consulting is here to guide SMEs through this crucial ascent, helping them harness Artificial Intelligence with clarity, confidence, and purpose.

patrick.title: Patrick Reverchon
patrick.subtitle: (Founder and CEO)
patrick.quote:
I grew up in a family where medium-sized enterprises played an important role, so they are particularly close to my heart.

I founded Crux Consulting to bring the possibilities of automation and Artificial Intelligence to those companies that don't necessarily have the capacity and budget to fully leverage their potential. SMEs are the backbone of our society and economy and I want to empower them as much as possible.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: The protection of your personal data is of particular concern to us. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy.
introduction.paragraph2: This privacy policy informs you about how we collect, process and use personal data on our website.

responsible.title: 2. Data Controller
responsible.paragraph1: The entity responsible for data processing on this website within the meaning of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is:

accessData.title: 3. Access Data (Server Log Files)
accessData.paragraph1: When visiting this website, information is automatically collected and stored in so-called server log files by the hosting provider, which your browser automatically transmits. These are:
accessData.paragraph2: This data is not merged with other data sources. The collection is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR â€“ the legitimate interest consists in the technically error-free presentation and optimization of the website.

contact.title: 4. Contact
contact.paragraph1: If you contact us by email or telephone, your details will be stored by us for the purpose of processing the inquiry and in case of follow-up questions.
contact.paragraph2: The processing of this data is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR (for the implementation of pre-contractual measures) or on the basis of our legitimate interest (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR) to contact you.

rights.title: 5. Your Rights
rights.paragraph1: According to GDPR you have the right to:

items.dataAccess: Information about your stored data (Art. 15 GDPR)

rights.paragraph3: You also have the right to complain to a data protection supervisory authority.

changes.title: 6. Changes to this Privacy Policy
changes.paragraph1: We reserve the right to adapt this privacy policy as needed so that it always complies with current legal requirements.
